greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the product of the distinct primes of form 6*k-1 that divide n.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: A170825 := proc(n) a := 1 ; for p in numtheory[factorset](n) do if p mod 6 = 5 then a := a*p ; end if ; end do ; a ; end proc: seq(A170825(n),n=1..120) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 21 2010
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); for(i=1, #f~, f[i,2] = (f[i,1]%6)==5); factorback(f); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 30 2020
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 25 2009, following a suggestion from _Jonathan Vos Post_
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 21 2010
